summary: Unit tests hang when the workflow under test encounters a runtime or compile-time exception. The test framework doesn't properly handle or surface exceptions that occur during workflow execution, causing the test to block indefinitely.
userImpact: Developers cannot effectively unit test workflows that may throw exceptions, as tests hang instead of providing error details.
rootCause: The testing framework does not properly propagate or handle exceptions occurring within the workflow under test, causing the client to wait indefinitely instead of failing or returning the exception.
workaround: Use logging and event listeners/interceptors to capture errors, or extend custom data converters to pass modified structures in tests.
keyQuote: When unit testing a workflow, if the workflow under test encounters a runtime exception the unit test hangs.
